skill.name: frontend-aesthetics
skill.description: Use when creating UI designs to avoid generic "AI slop" aesthetics. Enforces distinctive typography, cohesive color systems, purposeful motion, and atmospheric backgrounds. Critical for landing pages, dashboards, and branded interfaces.
skill.summary: Use when creating UI designs to avoid generic "AI slop" aesthetics. Enforces distinctive typography,...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/prompt-based skill containing only design guidelines, code examples, and anti-patterns. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands are present.

content.value_statement: AI often defaults to generic, overused design patterns that make interfaces immediately recognizable as machine-generated. This skill provides specific alternatives for typography, color, motion, and depth to create professional, branded interfaces.
actual_capabilities: Guide font selection with distinctive typography alternatives beyond Inter/Roboto
Implement cohesive color systems with single accent color and true dark backgrounds
Add purposeful motion using CSS transitions and Framer Motion patterns
Create atmospheric depth with gradients, orbs, and layered backgrounds
Identify and avoid common AI-generated design anti-patterns
limitations: Does not generate actual code files or modify existing projects
Does not install or configure design system dependencies
Does not validate designs against accessibility standards
Requires manual implementation of suggested patterns

use_cases.title: Professional Dashboard UI
use_cases.description: Build data-dense dashboards with proper typography hierarchy, brand accent colors, and subtle motion for state changes.

use_cases.title: Branded Landing Pages
use_cases.description: Create landing pages with distinctive visual identity, atmospheric backgrounds, and purposeful micro-interactions.

use_cases.title: Cohesive Design Systems
use_cases.description: Establish consistent design tokens, component patterns, and motion standards across your application.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Design Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the frontend-aesthetics skill to design a button component with proper hover states, shadow effects, and consistent brand styling.

prompt_templates.title: Dashboard Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply frontend-aesthetics principles to create a professional dashboard card showing system metrics with proper typography, accent colors, and subtle animations.

prompt_templates.title: Landing Page
prompt_templates.prompt: Following frontend-aesthetics guidelines, design a landing page hero section with atmospheric depth, distinctive typography, and staggered reveal animations.

prompt_templates.title: Design Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the following UI code using frontend-aesthetics anti-patterns. Identify all violations and suggest specific improvements with corrected code examples.

output_examples.input: Design a submit button with hover effects
output: Use a single brand accent color with solid fill
Add scale transform (hover:scale-105) and shadow glow
Apply smooth ease-out transition with 200ms duration
Avoid gradients, multiple primary buttons, or bounce animations

best_practices: Pick one brand accent color and use it consistently across all interactive elements
Use true dark backgrounds (neutral-950) instead of gray variants
Apply staggered reveals for lists using animation-delay with 100ms increments
Test reduced-motion preferences for accessibility compliance
anti_patterns: Using Inter/Roboto as primary fonts creates generic, AI-generated appearance
Purple/blue gradients and gray backgrounds signal AI-generated design
Static pages without any motion feel lifeless and unprofessional
Multiple primary buttons or colorful icons break visual hierarchy

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for frontend design guidance.

faq.question: What font families are recommended?
faq.answer: Plus Jakarta Sans, Bricolage Grotesque, Space Grotesk, and JetBrains Mono create distinctive, professional typography.

faq.question: Does this skill generate code?
faq.answer: No. It provides design patterns and guidelines for you to implement. The AI must write the actual code.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation and prompts. It does not access files, network, or system resources.

faq.question: How is this different from default AI behavior?
faq.answer: Claude defaults to safe, common patterns. This skill provides specific alternatives to create distinctive, branded interfaces.

faq.question: What animation library does this support?
faq.answer: Both CSS transitions and Framer Motion patterns are covered. CSS is preferred for simple interactions; Framer Motion for orchestrated animations.
